result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Entered in Error.
Preliminary Hearing 11-9-22 at 3:30 PM  - WRIT will be  needed
No acts/threats of violence towards CCI Correctional Officers. Standard felony conditions. - Refused to sign

11:04 AM Cases called: 22CF592 and 22CF594. Defendant Jovan Williams in court, in custody at Columbia Correctional Institution.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant requested reading of complaints by Court. Court read the required portions of the complaints. Advised the defendant of his rights. Bond recommendations. Statements from defendant opposing the recommended bond conditions. Court set $2500.00 signature bond in each case. No acts/threats of violence towards any of the CCI correctional officers. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing not waived. Court noted defendant refused to sign the bond form. 11:32 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
